data.oai_dc:dc: The data set consists of records of Pittosporum sucker (Trioza vitreoradiata), in the UK and Ireland gathered by the Royal Horticultural Society, from members of the Society, the general public. It also includes published records and those submitted to the Food and Environmental Research Agency (Fera) prior to 2014.Records of Pittosporum sucker (Trioza vitreoradiata) have been collected via the Royal Horticultural Society Advisory Service (predominantly from RHS members), Fera and published material|Data have been collected as part of the surveying work of the Royal Horticultural Society to establish the distribution and spread of Fuchsia Gall mite, an non-native pest of fuchsia, which probably became established in the UK in 2007.|313 occurrences
